Intel is teaching a computer chip to smell
Loihi, Intel's first neuromorphic computing chip, was unveiled in 2017 and pitched by the company as the next generation of AI, capable of applying the principles of computation found in biological brains to computer architectures. Loihi is capable of self-learning thanks to a new type of neural network dubbed "spiking neural network".
